name: Holiday Inn Express Moncton

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights while in town for a summer hockey tournament. We have 2 adults and 3 kids in our family. We booked a suite with two double beds and a pull out couch.
reviews.title: A clean and quiet hotel on the highway

reviews.text: The room was clean and the hotel was very quiet given its location on the highway and it was full of families and couples. We never heard a peep the whole week-end while we were in our room. Ask for room facing in - not one facing the highway.
reviews.title: Standard Holiday Inn

reviews.text: The place is a little tired and the pool area is hot and it was annoying that you could not open the doors to the outside to let in fresh air.
reviews.title: bit confusing but good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was fine and the staff were excellent. I found it expensive at $149 plus tax for the room.
reviews.title: Hotel stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Alarming night

reviews.text: The hotel is simply an average hotel though it does have a few things going for it: location, cleanliness and economical. The hotel is located directly across the street from the Casino and there are sidewalks to make navigation to the Casino easy. And a couple minutes drive is Magnetic Hill (Zoo and Waterpark). The hotel was very clean and I never one noticed deficiencies in this respect. I even noticed cleaning staff cleaning behind the guest washers/dryers… when was the last time you did that at your home? The beds, though a little high, are clean and provide a good night sleep. There is adequate water pressure and hot water even during peak morning usage times. During the off-season, it is possible to find a room for less than $100 per night though the summer peak season will find high rates. The room décor is fine, though just on the edge of going into the “outdated” category. Some of the ground floor rooms provide individual exterior entrances (much like a motel) and the hotel is “pet friendly”. The front desk staff was very courteous. The onsite breakfast offers something for everyone and is a welcomed start to the day. If the hotel was not in the location that it is, I would most likely give an overall rating of “three (3)”. That said, I would have no issue on returning to the Holiday Inn Express Moncton in the future.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Above Average Location

reviews.text: I have been staying at the Holiday Inn Express in Moncton NB for the past 8 years on Business almost 4 to 5 times a year. Service is always excellent and the location is perfect. In addition, I consider it to be an outstanding value for the rates charged. I have recommended it to my friends as the place to stay in Moncton NB.
reviews.title: First class Inn where I always stay when visiting that City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needing a place to stay overnight which was accessible, we called HIE in Moncton and found that they were almost fully booked because of a meeting of clothing wholesalers and there were no accessible rooms on the first floor. That wouldn't have been a problem except they do not have an elevator in the part of the hotel which had available rooms. The friendly desk clerk suggested a small suite which was nice, but a little pricier than we had wanted. However, we took it and had a nice evening there. The breakfast was typical Holiday Inn Express, which we enjoy--especially the cinnamon rolls! The complimentary guest laundry was a plus--except it was quite a walk from our room. My husband took advantage of the exercise room, too.
reviews.title: Just an overnight stay...

reviews.text: My wife and I recently traveled to the Maritimes for the first time to visit our son. Late September was a great time to visit, and people were very friendly and helpful, and the area was scenic and relaxing. We stayed at the Moncton Holiday Inn Express for our last night before flying out of the Moncton Airport early the next day.
reviews.title: Really nice room, great shuttle service to airport

reviews.text: Most of the motels and inns that we stayed at in New Brunswick and Nova Scotia needed updating -- old polyester comforters, smelly rooms, worn carpets, and somewhat decrepit facilities. Claimed wi-fi oftentimes was a disappointment -- one would have to camp out in the lobby to get it.
reviews.title: Clean, convenient ad friendly.

reviews.text: We stayed here as we wanted to be close to Casino NB, as well as having a place with a pool and a good breakfast. The pool and breaktfast did not disappoint. Lots of hot and cold choices, and a decent sized room so chances are you could find a table. Also the best hotel coffee I've had. The pool was warm and the hot tub was comfortable. The rooms were a little musty but clean. We had some problems. First, we were travelling with a person who needs a wheel chair. We had requested a room close to a door, which they did provide, But all the doors have lips on the floor, and in order to get the chair in and out, we would have to get the person to stand up, walk in, and then we used the chair after that. The staff were helpful in trying to deal with this, and in the end, we were given a room with a drive up, so we just let the person out, and they only had to walk right into the room. We did have some other problems, such as a broken lamp. In all fairness, the staff were more than nice about it, and the manager gave us a nice amount of Priority Club points for this. It could use some upgrades as it is an old place, but I would stay again.
reviews.title: Not bad, but could use a few upgrades

reviews.text: we stayed here on our way to PEI. the hotel has seen its day, needs some room updates, found it a bit musty, we stayed on the main level room 127. continental breakfast was good kids love the pancakes! close to magnetic hill.
reviews.title: average hotel could use some updates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, I had read the reviews on this site before booking and realized that this was an older hotel, which is fine... there was an unpleasant smell in the washroom, which I initially attributed to the toilet being slow flushing, but a day later when looking from the shower to the other side realized that there was a small pool of dried urine on the back of the toilet- and this is after the room had (theoretically) been cleaned twice!! We called the front desk and they sent over a manager and cleaner right away, both apologized profusely but we had to stay another night and the smell was still there, so who knows what wasn't visible... wore my shoes everywhere in the room the rest of the time. Due to this experience, would definitely not recommend this hotel and would never stay here again- gross!!
reviews.title: Bathroom filthy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I travel all the time for my work and I also have done some backpacking. I have stayed in different type of accommodations, anywhere from hostels to a Five-Diamond hotel. I can make a difference between reality and unrealistic travelers expectations.
reviews.title: Good, you get what you pay for

reviews.text: Location: Perfect. We usually book hotels right downtown. This time, we decided to stay a little bit further to save money. Im glad we did because the downtown core is so small that for us, it wasn't worth the extra money. The hotel is also located right across from the New-Brunswick casino. We drove down on mountain road and there is big box stores, restaurants, coffee places not far from hotel. The big mall is 10 minutes drive.
reviews.title: Average Hotel by the Highway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love staying in Holiday Inns - usually nice and clean and large rooms. But this time I found the hotel a bit tired looking, the carpets were old and needing cleaning and the paint chipping a bit in the shower. Great choices for breakfast -- but I would recommend Holiday Inn spruce up this property. Nice casino a short walk away.
reviews.title: Great breakfast, but rooms a bit tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was basic but nice and very clean. Breakfast was also basic but good. The one complaint I have is the hot tub was very dirty on the tile part, water itself was clean but tile that was out of the water had dirt that looked old.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel to stay at for one night. In my previous job I traveled a lot and stayed at numerous Holiday Inn's. Sadly this one does not live up to the Holiday Inn standards. The bed was terrible. It very noticeably sagged in the middle and the sheets were itchy.
reviews.title: Not a great experience

reviews.text: The room was not totally clean and we found a coffee cup that was still sitting on the window ledge. It had obviously been there quite some time and there were dead bugs floating in it.
reviews.title: Everything was Good.

reviews.text: The breakfast was your average HI experience.
reviews.title: Ok based on price

aka: Holiday Inn Express Moncton Hotel Moncton
description: Moncton Hotel near Magnetic Hill Golf Course Welcomes You The Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Moncton, conveniently located in central New Brunswick, is a hub for business and leisure travelers. From corporate meetings to a hot breakfast, our hotel covers all the bases to make your stay truly enjoyable. Leisure guests appreciate our central location in Moncton. Hotels in our area cannot keep up with our great value, comfort and convenience. Kiwanis Park, Moncton City Hospital and the University of Moncton are attractions near our hotel. Moncton travelers will find several other activities nearby as well, including Magic Mountain, Magnetic Hill Zoo and Champlain Place. Business travelers can rest assured knowing that we will make sure our accommodations are the best of the local hotels in Moncton, New Brunswick. Our clean and comfortable rooms provide both a station of productivity and a comfy bed for sleeping off the work day. The desk with an ergonomic chair, high-speed, wireless Internet access and local phone calls will help you get all of your work done. In addition, you can utilize our nine conference rooms with A/V equipment and our business centre for any other business needs you may have. Make the smart choice and stay in the pet friendly Moncton hotel near the University of Moncton, where you can enjoy our free hot breakfast, heated indoor pool and state-of-the-art fitness centre. Make your reservations today.
